column4: I'm having trouble with what should be an ordinary task: using a standard USB stick to transfer files back and forth between Ubuntu & Windows. The stick has been "known good," but today Ubuntu saw it only as an "8mb file system," listed its contents with wild filenames, & then sometimes didn't see it at all. I put it in a Windows machine, which reported it as corrupt. I reformatted it there, and now Ubuntu doesn't see it at all. I've had
problems on Ubuntu with USB sticks before. Is there something I'm doing wrong? Something I need to know?
How big are the files you need to transfer? If they're small files, maybe dropbox would be an alternative
